ygData.subject: Re: Languages
ygData.msgSnippet: I have found that I don t have to spend any training points in the language to learn from others.  I just had someone speak to me in the language.  Then then
ygData.messageBody:
I have found that I don't have to spend any training points in the language
to learn from others. I just had someone speak to me in the language. Then
then next time I zoned, I found I had acquired learning in that language.

----- Original Message -----
From: Karl Hatteland <karlh@...>
To: <eq_wizards@onelist.com>
Sent: Monday, May 24, 1999 4:47 PM
Subject: Re: [eq_wizards] Languages


> From: "Karl Hatteland" <karlh@...>
>
> You have to put one training point into it, then it will be as good as you
> have learnt from your friend :)
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Gregory Egan <gemd@...>
> To: eq_wizards@onelist.com <eq_wizards@onelist.com>
> Date: Tuesday, May 25, 1999 1:32 AM
> Subject: [eq_wizards] Languages
>
>
> >From: Gregory Egan <gemd@...>
> >
> >I have a friend who is teaching me Elvish. He spams me with a macro, "you
> >are learning the Elvish tongue", and I occasionally get a message saying
my
> >language skill is improving. But then I noticed that the only language I
> >have a skill for, besides common, is Erudian, which is at awful level.
Does
> >anyone know if you can learn the other languages if they are not listed
in
> >your skills? Thanks.
> >
> >Greg (Kronan)
> >
> >------------------------------------------------------------------------
> >With more than 17 million e-mails exchanged daily...
> >http://www.onelist.com
> >...ONElist is THE place where the world talks!
> >
>
>
> ------------------------------------------------------------------------
> ONElist members are using Shared Files in great ways!
> http://www.onelist.com
> Are you? If not, see our homepage for details.
>
